Content:
Got really sick of looking for file locations just from extensions so I made a quick and dirty directory and extension lister. I can pack it as a .exe but its probably easier just to save the text and just run the .py from your cli.

```import os
import tkinter as tk
from tkinter import filedialog, messagebox
from tkinter import Menu

class FileLister:
    def __init__(self, master):
        self.master = master
        self.master.title("File Lister")
        self.master.geometry("400x400")

        self.create_widgets()

    def create_widgets(self):
        self.create_directory_button()
        self.create_extension_entry()
        self.create_listbox()
        self.create_menu()

    def create_directory_button(self):
        directory_frame = tk.Frame(self.master)
        directory_frame.pack(side=tk.TOP, fill=tk.X)

        directory_label = tk.Label(directory_frame, text="Directory:")
        directory_label.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5, pady=5)

        self.directory_var = tk.StringVar()
        directory_entry = tk.Entry(directory_frame, textvariable=self.directory_var)
        directory_entry.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5, pady=5, fill=tk.X, expand=True)

        directory_button = tk.Button(directory_frame, text="Choose Directory", command=self.choose_directory)
        directory_button.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5, pady=5)

    def create_extension_entry(self):
        extension_frame = tk.Frame(self.master)
        extension_frame.pack(side=tk.TOP, fill=tk.X)

        extension_label = tk.Label(extension_frame, text="Extension:")
        extension_label.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5, pady=5)

        self.extension_var = tk.StringVar(value=".txt")
        extension_entry = tk.Entry(extension_frame, textvariable=self.extension_var)
        extension_entry.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5, pady=5, fill=tk.X, expand=True)

        extension_button = tk.Button(extension_frame, text="List Files", command=self.list_files)
        extension_button.pack(side=tk.LEFT, padx=5, pady=5)

    def create_listbox(self):
        listbox_frame = tk.Frame(self.master)
        listbox_frame.pack(side=tk.TOP, fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True)

        scrollbar = tk.Scrollbar(listbox_frame)
        scrollbar.pack(side=tk.RIGHT, fill=tk.Y)

        self.listbox = tk.Listbox(listbox_frame, yscrollcommand=scrollbar.set)
        self.listbox.pack(side=tk.LEFT, fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True)

        scrollbar.config(command=self.listbox.yview)

        self.listbox.bind("<Button-3>", self.show_menu)

    def show_menu(self, event):
        self.listbox.selection_clear(0, tk.END)
        self.listbox.selection_set(self.listbox.nearest(event.y))
        self.listbox.activate(self.listbox.nearest(event.y))
        self.popup_menu.post(event.x_root, event.y_root)

    def create_menu(self):
        self.popup_menu = Menu(self.listbox, tearoff=0)
        self.popup_menu.add_command(label="Open File", command=self.open_file)

    def choose_directory(self):
        directory_path = filedialog.askdirectory()
        if directory_path:
            self.directory_var.set(directory_path)

    def list_files(self):
        self.listbox.delete(0, tk.END)
        directory_path = self.directory_var.get()
        extension = self.extension_var.get()
        for root, dirs, files in os.walk(directory_path):
            for file in files:
                if file.endswith(extension):
                    self.listbox.insert(tk.END, os.path.join(root, file))

    def open_file(self):
        selected_item = self.listbox.get(self.listbox.curselection())
        os.startfile(selected_item)
        
if __name__ == '__main__':
    root = tk.Tk()
    app = FileLister(root)
    root.mainloop()```
